GT-Scan finds optimal targets for genome editing or regulatory interference using CRISPR/Cas or zinc-finger nuclease systems.

The MEME Suite

Motif-based sequence analysis tools

The MEME Suite allows you to:

  • discover motifs using MEME, MEME-ChIP (nucleotide only), DREME (nucleotide only) or GLAM2 on groups of related DNA or protein sequences,
  • search sequence databases with motifs using MAST, FIMO, MCAST or GLAM2SCAN,
  • compare motif(s) to all motifs in a database of motifs,
  • associate motifs with Gene Ontology terms via their putative target genes, and
  • analyze motif enrichment using AME, CentriMo or SpaMo.

To use one of the online tools either click on a logo below or select a tool from the menu on the left side of the page.

MEME

Multiple Em for Motif Elicitation

MAST

Motif Alignment & Search Tool

Tomtom

Motif Comparison Tool

GOMo

Gene Ontology for Motifs

GLAM2

Gapped Local Alignment of Motifs

GLAM2Scan

Scanning with Gapped Motifs

FIMO

Find Individual Motif Occurrences

MCAST

Motif Cluster Alignment and Search Tool

MEME-ChIP

Motif Analysis of Large Nucleotide Datasets

SpaMo

Spaced Motif Analysis Tool

DREME

Discriminative Regular Expression Motif Elicitation

CentriMo

Local Motif Enrichment Analysis

AME

Analysis of Motif Enrichment

GT-Scan

Identifying Unique Genomic Targets

Maintenance and development of the MEME Suite is funded by the National Center for Research Resources grant NIH/NCRR R01 RR021692. The MEME Suite web server is funded by the National Biomedical Computation Resource.
